column4: are there any good screenlets or other ways to keep tabs on receiving new emails?
there's a mailbox watcher thingy for gnome
I don't know if it does gmail.. but it does regular pop and imap at least
it's a regular application afaik.. resides in the systray
you get a little popup with the header info.. then it launches whatever mail software you want to actually read the mail
I just checked.. it handles gmail, pop, imap, regular linux mailbox
I don't know about best.. it works for me.. try it.. if you don't like it, uninstall it

apt-get remove, removes the program binaries but not configuration files... apt-get remove --purge removes everything, binaries + config. I don't know of a third way. (in synaptic "completely remove"=--purge, "remove"=remove)
no.. dependencies are taken care of automagically by apt... if you have something installed that nothing needs it will tell you when you run apt-get install in a terminal
yes.. it will print something like "The following packages aren't needed anymore.. to remove them run bla bla bla"
well.. everything is packages in apt.. you install the firefox package, you install the openoffice package.. you install the wine package
but dependencies in apt just means that one package needs another one to be installed..
I think they both use the same backend.. they are compatible.. you can install with one and uninstall with the other
but aptitude has this little nice terminal gui thing going.. some people like that
